Reviews.Title: cheap price, cheaply made
Reviews.Author: R. Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera came with terrific features for a great price.  It took fine photos.  Unfortunately, there was a problem deleting pictures in-camera (the cursor would scroll wildly on its own.)  I emailed Kodak to return it as defective. The camera body itself is not metal.  It is thin, flimsy plastic made to look like metal.  The knob on the top used to choose photo styles is flimsy and would turn and change while inside my pocket.  If you want an inexpensive camera that has great features and are willing to baby it so it doesn't get crushed or broken, this might be the camera for you.  If you're as tough on cameras (or do extensive traveling, etc.) you may want to look for a sturdier camera.  After returning the Kodak (sad, since this was my 4th Kodak camera and they have never let me down until now,) I bought a Pentax Optio M30 that has a metal body and sturdier controls for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for a beginner
Reviews.Author: M. A. Valadas "Alex"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a chrsitmas present for my sister. She wanted a small camera, with plenty enough of modes and easy to use. I have to say that I got the camera a couple of days ago, and I have expereminting with it. And I have to say that is a great camera for a beginner. The digital image stabilization is great for those who don't have a steady hand, and it comes with great picture taking modes, such as snowy day, baby mode, self picture close up, candle light, sunset, amog several others. I extensively experimented with some of these and the panorama mode, and I have to say that for a camera like this, the pictures came out great.The panorama mode was really easy and the results were amazing.I've experimented with low light in the ISo mode, and I really liked the compensation.If you are a beginner and if you want a small, handy and fun camera for a great price, I think this is it!

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: K. Simpson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a month ago & have been very happy w/ the quality of the pictures, and the camera in general.  We use the camera quite often & the pics it takes both indoors and out have exceeded my expectations.  It is easy to use.  I have no hesitancy recommending this camera to others & was thinking of buying one for my mom for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: Warning for people who own the Kodak Printer Dock Plus!
Reviews.Author: D. Lees
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with the intention of using it with my current Kodak Printer Dock Plus, but it is not compatible even with the D-22 adapter that Kodak says that you need.  According to Kodak, the 2007 model cameras are not compatible with the adapter.  To date I have not received a satifactory resolution from Kodak.  I am sharing this in the hopes that I can save someone else the frustration.  If you purchase this camera, plan on purchasing the G610 printer dock if you want a compatible printer dock, as that is Kodak's recommendation.As far as the camera itself, I have been pleased with the quality of the pictures (at least how they look on the LCD) and the fast shutter speed.  I am but a casual camera user, I regret that I cannot even say photographer!  Only gave it a 1 star rating for the printer compatibility issue and the customer support given by Kodak to date.

Reviews.Title: Digital Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: James D. Kluck
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Esyshare M853 is very easy to use.  the owner's guide is easy to understand.  The photo quality is excellent.  The compactness allows it to be carried comfortably in the shirt or trouser/shorts pockets.  The recovery time is very good.

Reviews.Title: Battery charging cable
Reviews.Author: Katty
Reviews.Content: The camera is in good condition but did not bring the cable to charge the battery. It is a used camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I have ever had!
Reviews.Author: Angela Rice
Reviews.Content: I recieved this camera for Christmas three years ago. At the time I was extatic to acually have a camera to call my own. Well as the months past by and I got to know my camera better, I noticed that the pictures I was taking where coming out very clear (and this is without developing them yet) and I was amazed at the prafomance it had for such a small camera.When I got my photo's developed I was even more surprised at the quality of the them.The features on this camera I have to say are very nice, it's great to have so many options, it's easy to use and take it from me, takes wonderful pictures. It's also easy to carry and very durable.I am a Photographer, and at the time when I was gifted this camera, I had no idea what career I was best at. Because this camera took such great pictures, it got me interested in photography and I can't picture myself being in any other career! lolSo if your looking for a good camera, despite the other reviews you might have read, I'll tell ya this is a wonderful camera. And you will be happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Stefanie
Reviews.Content: Im not a professional photographer or anything, just an average person who takes lots of day to day photos. this camera has been absolutely great. its very easy to use. The pictures come out great, it has great picture taking features such as image stabilization which reduces blurry pictures when the subject or camera is in motion. great for those disneyland tea cup ride pictures. this is just a basic camera, with basic features. it does its job very well. i have also noticed the battery life is amazing, i rarely have to charge it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, easy to share
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Chhouk "kisara of pern"
Reviews.Content: This item was exactly what I was looking for.  I am still new to using digital cameras, but the menu was easy to navigate, the pictures came out with crystal clarity, and it's cute to carry around!

Reviews.Title: Cheap camera, cheaper looking pictures
Reviews.Author: H. Salem
Reviews.Content: This camera is several steps below in photo quality than my 4 mp camera (very grainy) and lasted only 8 months before it just stopped working.  Next time I will shop around rather than making a quick decision on a day after Thanksgiving sale.

Reviews.Title: Kodak misses the boat again!
Reviews.Author: Buck Eye
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Target on BF.  Seemed like a great deal ($90) and the perfect opportunity to upgrade from my Kodak DX4330.  Right out of the box the camera looks good on the outside.  It is light and small.  Unfortunately, it takes horrible pictures.  I've tried indoor/outdoor, full light/low light etc.. All of the pictures came out grainy.  When I called the Kodak help desk they said it was caused by incorrect ISO settings.  While slightly changing the ISO settings somewhat helped the majority of the  grainyness remained. My 3.1 mp DX4330 takes much better pictures.Don't get me wrong, I know there are ISO settings for a reason but if I have to fiddle with changing the ISO setting every time I want to take a picture I might go mad.BTW, don't bother with the Kodak M883.  According to the CSR it has the same issues.AVOID THIS CAMERA LIKE THE PLAGUE. you would be better spending a little more money to get a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Battery problems
Reviews.Author: daddygimp1934 "Brownie"
Reviews.Content: This camera uses a proprietary Kodak battery, not standard AAA or AA cells.  Your are out of business if you can't recharge the battery.  If you're taking many photos, there are no easy battery replacements.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.2 megapixels
High ISO 1250 setting - 2.5 inch LCD - Pictbridge - Sound movies!
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M853 8.2 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom (Silver)
